content: लिंगं [लिंग्-अच्] {@--1@} A mark, sign, token, an emblem, a badge, symbol, distinguishing mark, characteristic; यतिपार्थिवलिंगधारिणौ <ls>R. 8. 16</ls>; अथवा प्रावृषेण्यैरेव लिंगैर्मम राजोपचारः संप्रति <ls>V. 4.</ls> मुनिर्दोहदलिंगदर्शी <ls n="V.">14. 71</ls>; <ls>Ms. 1. 30</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">8. 25</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 8.">252.</ls> {@--2@} A false or unreal mark, a guise, disguise, a deceptive badge; लिंगैर्मुदः संवृतविक्रियास्ते <ls>R. 7. 30</ls>; क्षपणकलिंगधारी <ls>Mu. 1</ls>; न लिंगं धर्मकारणं <ls>H. 4. 85</ls>, see लिंगिन् below. {@--3@} A symptom, mark of disease. {@--4@} A means of proof, a proof, evidence. {@--5@} (In logic) The {%hetu%} or middle term in a syllogism; particularly the assertion of the {%hetu's%} being found in the पक्ष or minor term coupled with the statement of the invariable concomitance between this {%hetu%} and the major term; it is thus defined: --व्याप्तिपक्षधर्मतावल्लिंगम् <ls>Tarka K.</ls> {@--6@} The sign of gender or sex. {@--7@} Sex; गुणाः पूजास्थानं गुणिषु न चलिंगं न च वयः <ls>U. 4. 11.</ls> {@--8@} The male organ of generation. {@--9@} Gender (in <ab>gram.</ab>) {@--10@} The genital organ of Śiva worshipped in the form of a Phallus. {@--11@} The image of a god, an idol. {@--12@} One of the relations or indications (such as संयोग, वियोग, साहचर्य &c.) which serve to fix the meaning of a word in any particular passage; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} in कुपितो मकरध्वजः the word कुंपित restricts the meaning of मकरध्वज to ‘Kāma’; see <ls>K. P. 2</ls> and commentary {%ad loc.%} {@--13@} (In Vedānta <ab>phil.</ab>) The subtle frame or body, the indestructible original of the gross or visible body. <ab>cf.</ab> पचंकोष. {@--14@} A spot, stain. {@--15@} The nominal base, the crude form of a noun (प्रातिपदिक). {@--16@} (In Sān. <ab>phil.</ab>) Pradhāna or Prakṛti; <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--17@} The effect or product (that which is evolved out of a primary cause and itself becomes a producer).
